sense.name: a pointer or indicator on a scale, dial or other instrument
sense.examples: The shadow cast by the index on a sundial tells you what time it is. The index on this scale is pointing to zero.

sense.name: a computed value or measure for a set of data
sense.examples: The Consumer Price Index rose slightly last month. Some economists don't think housing starts are a good index of how the economy is doing. The S&P 500 is a stock index.

sense.name: a notation in mathematics
sense.commentary: INDEX[+symbol][+notation][+mathematical] Note: this usage often occurs in the plural, indices
sense.examples: Sum the values for this function with index beginning at i + 1. The hash function assigns an index to each value in the table.

sense.name: written reference in the form of an alphabetical listing
sense.examples: I found John's name in the index of this textbook. We can't build our ontology on the model of a book index. I taught my child to use several different indexes at the library.

sense.name: the finger next to the thumb, forefinger
sense.examples: Hold the sample carefully between your index and thumb. The bank clerk really sorts money fast, using her right index.
